meanings.definition: A plural form of the word 'pes', meaning foot.
meanings.sent1: She walked on her pedes to reach the park.
meanings.sent2: The baby's tiny pedes were adorable.
meanings.sent3: The pedes of the table seemed to dance as she bumped into it.
meanings.sent4: His pedes carried him swiftly away from danger.
meanings.sent5: The pedes of the chair left marks on the floor.

meanings.definition: A plural form of the word 'pes', meaning a unit of linear measurement equal to 12 inches.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter measured the board in pedes.
meanings.sent2: The room was ten pedes long.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his height was six pedes.
meanings.sent4: The bridge spanned many pedes across the river.
meanings.sent5: The fabric was sold by the pedes at the market.

meanings.definition: A plural form of the word 'pes', meaning a type of insect with six legs.
meanings.sent1: The garden was full of colorful pedes crawling around.
meanings.sent2: She studied the anatomy of pedes in her biology class.
meanings.sent3: The pedes in the movie were wearing tiny hats.
meanings.sent4: The pedes scurried away when the light turned on.
meanings.sent5: The pedes left tiny footprints in the sand.
